greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n >= 1} 2/(k(n)*(k(n) + 1)), with k = A018252 (nonprime numbers).
comment: We know that Sum_{n >= 1} 2/(n^2 + n) = 2 and Sum_{n >= 1} 2/(p(n)*(p(n) + 1))  = 2*A179119, where p = A000040. Therefore, the present decimal expansion 1/1 + 1/10 + 1/21 + 1/36 + ... = 2*(1 - A179119).
mathematica: S = 2 - 2 NSum[(-1)^n PrimeZetaP[n], {n, 2, Infinity}, Method -> "AlternatingSigns", WorkingPrecision -> digits+5];
results.author: _Marco Ripà_, Apr 06 2019
